sections.TOP: House of Black and White027861124ga39xg1eaona5o6ql9s6tghurwow1662382014-11-26T16:15:31ZThe Dragon Demands5014364[[File:House of Black and White.png|thumb|250px|The entry to the House of Black and White has one black door, and one white door.]]The '''House of Black and White''' is a temple in [[Braavos]] dedicated to the [[God of Death]]. It also serves as the headquarters of the guild of assassins known as the [[Faceless Men]].
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, the House of Black and White sits upon a rocky knoll made of dark grey stone. It has no windows and has a black tile roof. Its wooden doors are twelve feet high and carved. The left door is [[weirwood]], the right ebony. In the center of the doors is a carved moon face ebony on weirwood, weirwood on ebony. Its grey stone steps lead down to the dock.

In the center of the main room on the main floor lies a pool ten feet across. Statues of gods stand around the room. There are statues of thirty gods in all. Among them are the [[Weeping Woman]], the [[Lion of Night]], Hooded Wayfarer, Bakkalon, the Moon-Pale Maiden, [[The Seven|the Stranger]] and the Merling King.
